abstract: The shareholders advisory group ISS Governance criticized the company’s decision to make Robert A. Iger chairman as well as chief executive, and also suggested his compensation had risen too sharply — criticism that Disney called flawed.
snippet: The shareholders advisory group ISS Governance criticized the company’s decision to make Robert A. Iger chairman as well as chief executive, and also suggested his compensation had risen too sharply — criticism that Disney called flawed.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The Walt Disney Company on Thursday went on the attack against a shareholder advisory service that earlier in the week criticized the entertainment conglomerate’s management structure and the compensation it awards its chief executive, Robert A. Iger.

headline.main: In Filings, Disney Rebuffs Criticism of Shareholders Advisory Service
